title: Tracking Issue for more complex const parameter types: `feature(adt_const_params)`

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
This is a tracking issue for allowing more const parameter types.
The feature gate for this issue is `#![feature(adt_const_params)]`.

### About tracking issues

Tracking issues are used to record the overall progress of implementation.
They are also used as hubs connecting to other relevant issues, e.g., bugs or open design questions.
A tracking issue is however *not* meant for large scale discussion, questions, or bug reports about a feature.
Instead, open a dedicated issue for the specific matter and add the relevant feature gate label.

### Steps

Most of the work here will be coordinated in the `#project-const-generics` stream on [zulip](https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/260443-project-const-generics).

- [x] Implement `valtrees`
- [ ] deal with structural equality
- [ ] Figure out which types should be allowed as const parameter types and how
- [ ] Document feature
- [ ] Stabilization report with lang FCP

cc @rust-lang/project-const-generics
